sentences.en: Bob was always genial and welcoming.
sentences.cn: 鲍勃总是那么友善热情。

sentences.en: Doctor Percival had struck him hitherto as a very genial man.
sentences.cn: 珀西瓦尔医生给他的印象一直是个和蔼可亲的人.

sentences.en: Harry was genial a soul as you could ever meet.
sentences.cn: 哈里是你所能遇到的最和蔼的人.

sentences.en: He knows how to spot genial smiles on the audience.
sentences.cn: 他知道怎样向观众们投送亲切的微笑.

sentences.en: He was a warm-hearted friend and genial host.
sentences.cn: 他是个热心的朋友，也是友善待客的主人。

sentences.en: He was tall, big - jowled, and genial.
sentences.cn: 他是个高个子, 下颚宽大, 性格温和.

sentences.en: He was tall, vigorous, sandy - haired, freckled, genial and voluble.
sentences.cn: 他个子高高的, 精神抖擞, 淡茶色的头发, 脸上有雀斑, 性情和蔼,口齿伶俐.

sentences.en: Her uncle looked at her awhile with genial acuteness.
sentences.cn: 姨父看了她一眼,目光显得和蔼而犀利.

sentences.en: His genial sufficiency was a taunt and a mockery to many.
sentences.cn: 他那么和蔼自满的态度,许多人都认为是一种辱骂和嘲弄.

sentences.en: His own genial nature reflects its sunshine through his pages.
sentences.cn: 篇页间可见其温文尔雅,光彩熠熠的秉性.

sentences.en: How the beautiful silk is affable, genial to everyone.
sentences.cn: 多丽丝对每个人都和蔼可亲.
奥兰多是一位和蔼可亲的人.

sentences.en: Stalin received this somewhat abrupt response with a genial grin.
sentences.cn: 斯大林对于这个相当生硬的回答抱以和蔼的一笑.

sentences.en: The latter's genial nature and dressy appearance pleased him.
sentences.cn: 杜洛埃为人和气,衣着讲究,这些都很合他的意.

sentences.en: They both were elderly men, and had genial voice.
sentences.cn: 他们两个都是快上年纪的人, 说起话来和声柔气的.

trans.tran_cn: 和蔼的，亲切的，温暖的，温和的，宜人的，显示天才的
